item.description:
What's the plan?

We'll do an approx. 7 mile hike on the Skyline loop at Middlesex Fells.  This should take us about 2.5 hours.  This one of the more strenuous trails in the Fells - we will climb 1,500 ft of elevation gain. There are some steep climbs to rocky outcrops with nice views of the surrounding area. We will hike at a relatively fast pace (3 to 3.5mph). Due to the pace, this is not a beginner hike - you should have experience hiking a similar pace/distance before.  So you know what to expect - we're out to get exercise, not take a leisurely, relaxed stroll in the woods. 

Where will we meet?

We're meeting at 5pm NEAR the Long Pond Parking (gate 13) on South Border Rd since Long Pond lot tends to be quite busy in the evening. Also, there WILL be rush hour traffic - so take that into account in your travel time.  We'll park at the pull-off just south of the Long Pond Parking lot. The approximate address (with your GPS) is 456 South Border Road, Winchester, MA.  Heading north on South Border Rd (from Exit 33 on I-93), you'll go about 1.5 miles. You'll pass the Water Plant on your right, and Leslie Rd on your left shortly before the pull off (parking is on your right). If you get to the gated Long Pond Parking (on your right) you've gone too far. Please be on time so we'll have ample time to finish this hike before sunset. I'll leave the lot promptly at 5:05pm. 

What should I bring?

Water, snack, good hiking shoes/trail runners, bug spray

More Info:

Rain will cancel - I'll send out an email (with my cell phone number) to confirmed participants the night before the hike to confirm details.

My well-behaved dog, Della, will likely join us for this hike.

You can find out more information about the Fells here: http://www.fells.org/visit/

And you can print out free maps here: http://www.fellsbiker.com/maps

Map view of parking area:   Parking
item.name: Evening Hike at Middlesex Fells - Fast-Paced Skyline Loop
